intro: Mimusops antongilensis, commonly known as the Antongil tamarind, is a deciduous tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and lanceolate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by woody, egg-shaped fruits. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role within its native habitat.
